foundationConcepts.title: What is USM?
foundationConcepts.summary: USM is a unified management system for any service organization, replacing scattered frameworks with one operating model.

detail.summary: USM (Unified Service Management) provides a single way to design, deliver, and improve services across your organization.
whyItMatters: Reduces complexity by providing one model instead of many frameworks.
Supports cross-department collaboration and shared language.
Helps leadership steer services based on a clear, consistent structure.

foundationConcepts.title: Why unified?
foundationConcepts.summary: Different departments often use different models. USM unifies them into one way of working.

detail.summary: A unified model avoids duplicated structures and conflicting practices between IT, HR, Facilities, and other domains.
whyItMatters: Eliminates fragmentation in how services are managed.
Makes it easier to implement governance and improvement organization-wide.
Supports better control, quality, and customer experience.

foundationConcepts.title: Principles, not practices
foundationConcepts.summary: USM is built on a small set of principles that stay stable while practices and tools may change.

detail.summary: USM provides structure and coordination; teams choose the practices and tools that fit their context.
whyItMatters: Focuses on reusable patterns instead of one-off solutions.
Supports scaling from one department to the whole enterprise.

processes.name: Agree Process
processes.oneLine: We make and maintain clear agreements about services.
processes.purpose: This process creates and maintains clear agreements about services — what they are, who they’re for, how they perform, and who is responsible for what.
keyResponsibilities: Define services and their intended outcomes.
Agree on service levels, responsibilities, and constraints.
Maintain agreements as context and needs change.
supportsControl: Gives leadership a consistent basis for steering all services.
Prevents misunderstandings about what a service should deliver.

processes.name: Change Process
processes.oneLine: We modify services in a controlled way.
processes.purpose: This process ensures that modifications to services and service systems happen in a deliberate and controlled way, rather than as accidental drift.
keyResponsibilities: Assess proposed changes and their impact.
Decide what will change and when.
supportsControl: Avoids uncontrolled change that undermines stability.
Links change decisions to structural impact and objectives.

processes.name: Operate Process
processes.oneLine: We run day-to-day service use as agreed.
processes.purpose: This process ensures that day-to-day use of services runs as agreed, supporting customers and users consistently.
keyResponsibilities: Support users in their daily work with services.
supportsControl: Provides real-world visibility into how services are running.
Creates consistent operating patterns across teams.

processes.name: Recover Process
processes.oneLine: We restore service when performance drops or fails.
processes.purpose: This process coordinates the restoration of service when performance drops or fails, so disruptions are handled calmly and predictably.
keyResponsibilities: Capture learning from events and feed it into improvement.
supportsControl: Reduces impact and uncertainty during disruptions.
Connects incident handling with structural learning.

processes.name: Improve Process
processes.oneLine: We learn from risks and results to strengthen the system.
processes.purpose: This process ensures systematic learning and structural strengthening of the service organization over time.
keyResponsibilities: Analyze risks, patterns, and performance results.
supportsControl: Shifts the focus from firefighting to foresight.

workflows.name: Request Workflow
workflows.summary: A consistent way for people to ask for services or support — without confusion or improvisation.

workflows.name: Incident Workflow
workflows.summary: A calm, structured way to restore agreed service when something goes wrong.

workflows.name: Change Workflow
workflows.summary: A controlled way to modify services or supporting systems, so improvement doesn’t create chaos.

workflows.name: Problem Workflow
workflows.summary: A disciplined way to discover and remove structural causes of recurring issues.

workflows.name: Knowledge Workflow
workflows.summary: A shared approach to creating and re-using reliable service knowledge across the organization.

workflows.name: Configuration / Asset Workflow
workflows.summary: A way to keep trusted information about the services, resources, and relationships the organization depends on.

workflows.name: Identity & Access Workflow
workflows.summary: A consistent way to manage who can use which services — based on clear roles and agreements.

workflows.name: Continuity / Availability Workflow
workflows.summary: A proactive way to protect service delivery when facing risk, disruption, or uncertainty.
